title: Zwitterion
summary: In chemistry, a zwitterion (/ˈtsvɪtəˌraɪən/ TSVIT-ə-rye-ən; from German  Zwitter [ˈtsvɪtɐ] 'hermaphrodite'), also called an inner salt, is a molecule that contains an equal number of positively- and negatively-charged functional groups.[1] With amino acids, for example, in solution a chemical equilibrium will be established between the "parent" molecule and the zwitterion.
